body_content.explanation: a period of time in the year when the members of a parliament, court of law, or other government organization are not meeting:
examples: The Supreme Court is in recess until October but could still consider the review request and respond at any time.
During summer recesses the newspaper sent him travelling round the country

body_content.explanation: in school, a period of time between classes when children do not study:
examples: Recruiters work the playground during recess and invite students and families to evening information sessions.
She never talked to teachers, never made friends, never played at recess.

body_content.explanation: a small area in a room that is formed by one part of a wall being set back further than other parts:
examples: The room has a recess designed to hold bookshelves.
Psychoanalysts aim to explore the deepest/innermost recesses of the mind.
